Replies.Reply: You know the problem with Hollywood? They make shit.

Take Dog Day Afternoon for example. Arguably Pacino's greatest performance, excepting The Godfather, Part I, and Scarface, of course. A masterpiece of directing, easily Lumet's best. The acting, the script, cinematography, all top notch. But, they didn't push the envelope. What if in Dog Day, Sonny really wanted to get away with it? What if, and here's where it gets tricky. What if they'd started killing hostages?
How many innocent victims would they let get sprayed across the windows before the city reversed its policy on hostage situations?
Just a thought. I mean it's not really within the realm of conventional cinema, but what if...?
Oh, well. Life does tend to be stranger than fiction.
Well, guys, gotta jet. This place is kinda dead.
Rene Descartes is sitting in some bar in Paris. Bartender says, 'Hey, you want another drink?' Descartes says, 'I think not.' And disappears.
Don't talk, listen... When I made my Dog Day Afternoon analogy, I was not speaking metaphorically.
On top of that we have taped 15 pounds of stainless steel ball bearings --
-- making them the world's largest walking Claymore mines.
Around her neck is a radio-
Dog walks out of his yard, he gets the shit shocked out of him.
-- their yard is this bank.      So, don't fuck with me.
You know, they say it's the clothes that make the man...
Actually you flew 1500 miles for 100 grand. But that's not the point.

I heard this story about this young hacker who made a virus that broke the F.B.I.'s Carnivore program that was actively reading every subscriber's E-mail and scrambled the systems. He did what the federal judges wouldn't do and kept the government out of our Privacy.
Stanley, we have a problem, maybe you can help us out.
No need for modesty, we're all friends here, Stanley.
You want something from me, amigo, I want something from you. D.O.D.
So it can be done? Maybe slide in a Trojan horse hiding a worm?
Sort of. Marco, let's give him some incentive.
I've been told the best crackers in the world could do this in sixty minutes. Unfortunately, I need someone who can do it in sixty seconds.
Forty-five seconds. Time is a wasting, big guy.
She's very good, isn't she, Stanley?
Too bad, Stanley. Ya gotta die.
I was just fucking with you, Stan.
Big Stan.   I was afraid we lost you.
Let's go up to the house. I'm having a little get-together. I'll explain it to you there.
So Stan, tell me. How'd you do it?
Break the code. At the club.
C'mon, you can do better than that. How'd you do it?
You definitely have a gift, Stan.
Here's the deal. I need a worm, Stanley. A hydra, actually. A multi-headed worm to break an encryption and then sniff out latent digital footprints throughout an encrypted network.
Tell ya what, I'll pay you ten million dollars. That should be enough to get your daughter back...
Well, Ging, doesn't this look friendly.
You look like shit. Ginger kick your ass?
I see you have a groupie.
Have you heard of Operation Swordfish?
-- In the early Eighties the D.E.A. set up a network of dummy corporations as a government front to launder drug money and gather evidence. Problem is, the front companies started making money.
It didn't disappear. It just sat in those accounts earning interest, it's been 15 years. You have any concept how much money we'd be actually talking about today?
Senator, I sincerely hope you did not contact me and jeopardize the safety of me and my men for this.
Sir, with all due respect. Do you think there is any aspect of this operation I am not fully aware of?
A vacation?   Have I ever failed you, sir?
It's my point. Senator, this operation is going forward.
What's wrong, Stanley, you look like you've seen a ghost?
'Cause I don't want to talk to you in the house, Stanley.
Something you need to say to me?
You know anything about Harry Houdini?
He used to make an elephant disappear in a theater full of people. You know how he did it?
Hope you had a light lunch, Stan.
It's just rough when you grow up lovin' James Bond movies. Don't worry, Stanley, it'll be over soon.
Get in the fucking car, Stanley.
You're on my good side and you want to stay there. Stanley, I like you, but don't confuse kindness with weakness. So, get in the fuckin' car. I need my hydra.
This's a catch-and-release stream, isn't it?
Oh c'mon, Jim. You gotta see the irony in the chairman of the Joint Sub-Committee on Crime, fishing in a catch-and-release stream.

How could you do it, Jim? After all we have sacrificed. All the blood, all the death... I've changed my identity so many times, I don't even know what I look like anymore. How could you turn on me when we are so close?
You brought me in to get the job done and you didn't want to know about the consequences.
I told you there was nothing that I was unaware of --
You have misplaced your loyalties, Senator. You have sold America out.
Thomas Jefferson once shot a man on the White House lawn for treason, Senator. You tried to execute me in the name of politics, now I execute you in the name of the people.
Make sure that bus doesn't top out over fifteen-seven.
I'm about to do something against my better judgement. I'm going to tell you something I never tell anyone. I'm going to tell you who I am.
Do you?    You think I'm a bank robber.    Really, I'm just like you.
That I am. And worse. Much worse.
200 years ago Thomas Jefferson wrote a letter to Madison because he was concerned that the freedoms of the constitution would be ignored.
Listen to me and you will. In the 1950s, armed with this letter, J. Edgar Hoover created an organization to protect the freedoms of this country at all costs.

Yes. You, your daughter and 200 million other Americans who take their freedoms for granted. You don't understand what it takes to protect those freedoms. That's my job, Stanley, to protect your way of life at all costs.
That's what I'm telling you, Stanley. We are at war.

Anyone who infringes on America's freedom. Terrorists' states, Stanley. Someone must take their war to them. They bomb a church, we bomb ten. They hijack a plane, we take out an airport. They execute American tourists, we tactically nuke an entire city.

Maybe. I wanted you to do this because you wanted to, because we need men like you, but our time table's been moved up. Just relax and it will all be over in twenty-four hours. You're rich, Stanley. Pretty soon Holly and you will be basking in the sun on the deck of some eighty-foot scarab, eating bon bons and living the good life.
No. He'll be back. We gotta move. Load up.
Get that son-of-a-bitch on the phone.
If you need to test my resolve then God help you. You have 25 minutes. That plane better be on the runway.
Do you really think I wanted it to come to this. Do you? I am not a psychopath, Stanley, but I told you, I will sacrifice as many lives as it takes to protect our country, including my own.
Both of you. You have my word, Stanley. C'mon.
They just cut the power. Forget it. How long to transfer the money?
National Bank of Zurich. Spread it evenly over these accounts. It won't be there that long.
Good job, Stanley, I got someone who wants to see you.
Told you I was a man of my word, Stanley.

In all reality, Stan, she has you to thank for this. That first night in Prague you broke the D.O.D. database that contained her true identity. She's D.E.A., Stan, but without you, I never would have known.
Then get me my money, Stan.
Take a moment, big guy. Don't make me put you in a wheelchair.
I didn't Stan, you did.    But we're not done yet.
There are a lot of hostages here.
They better hope you installed a back door or it could be a long day. Somebody get me a laptop.
Well, 'bout time for us to leave.
Au contraire. Do you hear that?
That's the sound of America watching.
I don't think any of us want a repeat of this morning. Keep at least a hundred yards from this bus at all times and I want the airspace for five miles clear.

Ladies and gentlemen, we will be in your lives for approximately 55 more minutes. This bus has just become your new yard. So sit back, think happy thoughts, and this will be over before you can say 'cat in the hat.'  Gabriel, smiling, turns to Stanley.
Replies.Didascalie: (dropping the mic and turning to the hostages)

Replies.Reply: Really? Five hundred bucks says I do. Tell ya what, Stanley, I'll even spot you the five bills.
You're not looking at the big picture.
Stanley, here's a scenario. You have the power to cure all of the world's diseases. But the price for this is that you must kill a single, innocent child. Could you kill that child to save the world?
You disappoint me, Stanley.   It's the greatest good.
Now you're getting it.   How about a hundred?
How about a thousand? Not to save the world, but just to preserve our way of life.

You're wrong, Stanley. Some men are put here to shape destiny, to protect freedom, despite the atrocities they must commit. I am one of those men. Thousands die every day for no reason at all, where is your bleeding heart for them? You give your twenty dollars to Greenpeace every year and think you are changing the world. What countries will harbor terrorists, when they realize the consequences of what I will do? Did you know I can buy nuclear warheads in Minsk for forty million each? I buy half a dozen, I even get a discount.
The only way to fly, huh, Stanley.
Well, Stanley, gotta fly. Take care of that little girl. Maybe I'll see you again one day.
C'mon, Stan. Everything doesn't always end the way you think it will.
Houdini made an elephant disappear in a room full of people.
You know how he did it?
Elephant suit.     Filled with his assistants.
Assistants jump out. Blend in with the others.
-- so advanced nowadays you could probably pilot it from your trailer.
You know, this movie of yours, I don't think it would have worked.
I've seen what this man is capable of --
Okay... Guys, why don't you give me a few minutes here?
It's okay.   Just a couple of minutes.
Why would the number one cracker in the world risk life imprisonment to enter the continental U.S.?
You need another cup of coffee --
Until a year ago I was head of the largest task force on cyber-
I tell you what, you tell me what I want to know and I guarantee you'll be on the next flight to Finland. First class. Courtesy of the U.S. Government.
That's a real nice story.    But you haven't given me shit.
At least it's not my wife.
You need to think about what else you know.
This is Roberts, I have a call from A.D. Joy.
Tell me you have some good news for me.
I know who Jobson is. I busted him.
I want to know who that girl is.
Cut him off at the bottom.
What are you doing in L.A., Stan?
Why were you running? We just wanted to talk.
For violating your parole by leaving Texas without permission or for evading a federal agent and almost getting me killed in the process?
Didn't know the court lifted the sanction preventing you from seeing your daughter.
You just want to cut through the pleasantries and get down to business? Fine. I can help you with your daughter, Stan. Help me, I'll help you.
Whether I agreed with what you did or not, you broke the law, Stanley.
So, why was it you are in L.A.
-- vacationing. That's right. Ya know it's funny. Axl Torvalds was just here for a vacation, too.
If you're not careful you can tell him yourself. He's dead.
In case you think of anything else you want to tell me.
You know, you're in way over your head here.
It's a long walk back up the hill, Stanley. You want us to give you a lift?
I'm working on it. Send what you have up-lines, maybe we'll have one by the end of the week.
You just gonna let them drive the fuck on outta here?
It sure looks like Gabriel Shear.
Keep looking. Bodies just don't fucking disappear.
Cheer up, Stan, we got him.
I was wrong about you, Stanley. I wanted you to know that. You know, you should take your daughter on vacation. Relax a little, you're lucky to be alive.
Bad guy can't win. It's a morality tale. One way or the other, he's gotta go down.
Who are you supposed to be?
How'd you get past my dog?
Great.   What are you selling again?
You're wasting your time. I even touch a computer, I go straight to Leavenworth, do not pass go, do not collect 200 dollars. Whatever I was...
I want to talk with Holly.
Don't do this, Mel. It's not good for Holly --
I just want to see my baby.
Wow, Mel, you can take the girl out of the trailer park, but you can't take the trailer park out of the girl.
Look, I'm beginning to lose my sense of humor about --
Do me the courtesy of not confusing your own childhood with my daughter's.
All the way through the jury trial?
I'm happy with what I'm wearing.
I flew fifteen hundred miles for this meeting, how 'bout we get to the point.
I think I heard that. Story is he went to jail and the federal Carnivore program is back in full swing. It was a real tragedy.
Look, I don't have a lot of patience for this --
You know I can't touch that.
Replies.Didascalie: (like an alcoholic faced with a fifth of tequila)

Replies.Reply: Something like that. Is this an interview?
Help? Help what, squeegee my brain off the ceiling?
A test... I don't know why I let you talk me into this. I can't believe how desperate I am.
Look... I'd do anything to get Holly back. But, if I end up in a box or back in jail, then I really can't help her, can I? What I should do, is take my money and go back to court.
What I'm thinking about is that you're willing to put a gun to my head to see if I can hack --
Tell me what the deal is.
I used a logic bomb, dropped it through the trap door --
I don't know exactly. I see the numbers. In my head. All my life. I don't answer equations, I just see the answers. Same with code. I can't explain ---
A Vernam's impossible. Its key code is destroyed upon implementation. Not to mention being a true 128 bit encryption.
I don't know. It's gonna be pretty hard without a gun to my head.
Can I borrow your car? There's something I need to do.
Me too, baby.    I brought you something.
It's okay, baby. Let me give you a ride home.
I've found a way to get you back, sweetheart. It's my one shot and I'm taking it. Just give me a couple of days.
Holly, everything's going to be okay. You just have to trust me.
Friend of a friend. Let's take a ride.
You'll have to forgive me, the fact that you put me in jail for 18 months doesn't inspire a lot of trust.
I guess we were both doing what we had to. This was a nice trip down memory lane, but if you're not arresting me...
I have to hand it to you, Ginger.
I should probably ask you the same question.
Sorry about your car. I've had a pretty shitty day so far. Looks like it just got worse.
You can't tell me? Well, that's just fuckin' peachy.
That's not my problem, is it?
-- I deserve to know who's playing me, Ginger.
Thought maybe you'd like to see me get you your hydra.
My senior year at M.I.T., I created the source code for the worm that I've been using for years.

In the basement and through a file room is the only P.D.P.-10 still active and on the internet, although only a few people know this. It's an I.T.S. machine and kept online just for historical sake. I hid my worm inside it where no one would ever think to look.
Now I just have to modify the code.
You know, it'd be a lot simpler if you would tell me exactly what the hydra is going to be used for?
Before we can tap into the secure cluster, you have to find one of the banks on the backbone of this network. Do you know how many banks there are in the U.S.? It could take years.
What the hell is going on here?
I'm not going anywhere until you tell me what's going on.
What do you think? I just watched that maniac murder ten men in the street. I'm just fucking great.
Trust you? Two hours ago I found out you're D.E.A. The feds are crawling up my ass and there's a dead body in the basement that looks just like Gabriel.
Your little slush fund is not my problem. I'm pulling the plug on this rodeo. Roberts may be an asshole, but he is definitely the lesser of the two evils.
You're starting to sound just like him.
Then let me go. I want to see my daughter.
Don't bother.     I know who you are.
I don't understand why the fuck you're telling me this.
I don't care about any of this.
So you and your band of lunatics are really stealing all this money to protect me.
You're going into the fucking bank.
War?   Who are we at war with?
I'm out. I'm not doing this.
Not until I see my daughter.
Will you let Holly go once you have the money?
Whoa! What the hell just happened?
It's okay.    I love you, baby.
Won't do you any good. The money jumps every 60 seconds from one numbered account to another and will for the next ten years.

You let the hostages go and then I'll tell you where and when you can extract the money. We all walk away, nobody gets hurt. The accounts are encrypted with a 1024 bit cipher. Even I can't break through the fire wall. It's my act of God policy.
Just let her down. I'll do whatever you want.
I'm not doing shit until you bring her down. I'm serious. Let her down. Now!
You didn't have to kill her.
I need another laptop, logged on!
Now, goddammit, it's done.   Let her go!
You'll never get away. Even if they have to kill everyone on the bus.
How the fuck can you justify all this?
No man has the right to make that decision. You're no different than any other terrorist.
I thought we were going to the airport.
It can't end like this.     You can't get away.
Are we sure this is Gabriel?
Everything's fine. Just making the last of some charitable donations..
By the way, where exactly are we going?
High ground one and two. You have a green light.
How long am I going to be delayed?
Whatever you can do to me, he can do worse. I'm already dead. The only place I stand a chance is back in my country. I have friends there.
I'll tell you what I know.
He exists in a world beyond your world. What we only fantasize, he does. He lives a life where nothing is beyond him.
But it is all an act.
For all his charisma and charm.
Beneath it all he is a driven, unflinching, calculating machine, who takes what he wants, when he wants, then disappears --
I fly to where I am to meet him.
He tells me what he needs. I do my job, I'm paid.
Mr. Torvalds. Could you step over here, please.
This better be important, you pulled me out of session.
Do they know who they are dealing with?
This ain't good, boys. The Vortex has used Torvalds before. What do the feds know?
You better get sure real quick, son, 'cause someone's cock's liable to end up on the block on this one. And I promise you it won't be mine.
I don't fucking pay you to think, Kaplan. I pay you to keep me informed. I know the Vortex.
It's like using the Ebola virus to cure a cancer patient. Son, what do you think's going to happen if he starts tying up loose ends.
Senator, I wouldn't have asked you to come here if it wasn't.
Senator, we just received a communication that Axl Torvalds was intercepted entering the continental U.S.
It is unlikely, sir. It was a routine check and Torvalds freaked out. They just got lucky.
Nothing as of yet. He's refusing to speak English and the Finnish consulate has already contacted the State Department...
We're not sure. We're working on that right now.
Senator, I think we'll be okay here --
Sir, he does work for us.
For someone the N.S.A. has listed as the most dangerous hacker in America, you sure don't look like much.
Don't look so surprised. I know everything there is to know about you, Stan. From your mom's maiden name to how big your...
Did I say I was selling something?
My employer wants to meet you.
You're not very good at this, are you?
You need to straighten your left arm. You're bending it.
This is not a nice place you have here, Stanley.
I've only been here a few minutes and I'm already starting to feel sorry for myself.
Stanley, think about it, they still teach your techniques at M.I.T.
I'm not here to suck your dick, Stanley, you can sit around doing the martyr thing as long as you like. He'll pay you just to meet you.
Oh that's right, and fine work it is, too.
Have you spoken to Holly lately?

Let's cut through the bullshit, Stan. If you ever want to have a chance in hell of getting your daughter back you'll shut up and listen. Unless of course you want to stay here in your pathetic, loser life while she learns what it's like to be a fluffer in one of her new daddy's videos.
How much would it cost to retain the best family lawyer in the country and regain custody of your daughter?
Whattaya have to lose? Just meet him. One time. That's it. You don't like the setup, walk away.
That's it.   And you keep the money.
I wish you'd let me buy you a suit.
Relax, Stanley. You can do this.
It was just a test, Stan, you passed.
I thought you were here saving your daughter, Stanley.
Back to court? Back to Melissa's gladiators? You throw a hundred grand at her, she'll throw five back at you. It's not about Holly, it's about beating you.
So, let me sum it up for you, Stanley. You live in a trailer.
You're a felon, working a dead-
No, you didn't. You didn't have time.
Mozart always said he didn't write music; he just wrote down what he heard in his head. So did Faulkner, just with words.
C'mon, Stan.   Let's get to work.
It won't bite you, I promise.
Well, let's put a gun to your head.
Tell me about your worm, Stanley.
You surprised that a girl with real breasts and an I.Q. over 70 can give you a hard-on?
I am not what you think I am.
You're a smart guy, Stanley.    You figure me out.
I thought we went over all that last night.
Look, no pictures. Get out of my light.
If you're going to see your daughter, you might want to reevaluate the way you look.
What are you doing here, Stanley?
I won't let anything happen to you, Stanley. You have to trust me.
Stanley, if we don't find out who he's working for then we're just going to have to do this all over again.
I've been working on this thing for eight months, and I will not let some jarhead fed fuck up my operation. Please, I know what I'm doing.
C'mon, Stanley. You have twelve hours. Do what he wants. Finish the worm.
Stanley. Why are you calling here?
Replies.Didascalie: (New York starts to invade her accentless accent)

Replies.Reply: How the hell would you know what is or isn't good for my daughter?

Well, she doesn't want to see you, Stanley, and I swear to fucking God, if you contact her, I'll have Larry's attorney throw you into a hole so deep and dark it'll make Leavenworth seem like two weeks in Vegas; during which I'll personally pay two ball-busting skin-heads to --
I will not let myself be manipulated by you, Stanley.
Larry's a film financier, a good husband, and an astute businessman. What films he's involved in are a function of profitability and none of your business.
Get help, Stanley, get into a program, get a therapist, get a dog, but whatever you do, stay away from my child.
She will never be your child.
Finland does not recognize these allegations as crimes. Your laws --
My client has repeatedly reserved his right not answer any questions at this time.

He told me to tell Mister Roberts that he is quite fond of 'The X-Files.'  Again they smile. Roberts looks at the lawyer's cup of steaming coffee and with one finger pushes it over into the lawyer's lap.
You will be hearing from my gover --
Stanley gives them all a "fuck you" smile, then stomps out through the curtain.
Stanley's heart almost stops.    He sighs as Gabriel tosses him the giraffe.
We see Stanley. He looks like he just got caught with his hand in the cookie jar.
One of the mercs in the front speaks French again.
Can I give you a lift?
Did you ever see the Maltese Falcon?
The, ah, stuff dreams are made of.
Look, creep, I don't think so --
Daddy... What are you doing here?
Oh, Daddy. If Mom finds out you're here she's gonna have you thrown back in jail.
I don't want anything else to happen to you, Dad.
Yep.   Got it all figured out.
Know why they call it the Petrified Forest?
The screen shows the MIT University logo.      Then "ACCESS DENIED." His fingers work the keyboard.
-- Seems you have gotten yourself in a predicament.
Goddamn right I did. You know where I got that? From the deputy director of the F.B.I. He thought I might be interested.
We are aborting the operation and securing alternative means of finance elsewhere.
You understand what you are saying?
Son, let's say you have a 200-
That's why we're here. You are too arrogant, too aggressive --
And what are you going to do with that?
Get your shit, we're headin' out.
You want to send a team after him?
Look at the cover pattern they've set up. The right hand doesn't know what the left's doing.
Look at this bozo. If the shit drops, he's gonna cap his buddy in the back of the head. Idiots.
Joy says the plane is ready.
Hello, Mr. Jobson. This is Kristine Jorgenson of Credit Suisse in Grand Cayman.
Mr. Jobson, there has just been a transfer of ten million U.S.
The bus was just lifted off the street by a giant helicopter.
Check the rest of the hostages, we'll come back for them.
The body's dentals exactly match the dentals the Israeli government sent us for an ex-Mossad agent named Gabriel Shears.
It is indeed Gabriel a.k.a. Gabriel Shear.
We searched all the hospitals and morgues but we haven't been able to find her body yet.
I would like to transfer money between my employer's accounts.
That's why I'm here. My employer doesn't like drawing attention to himself. He likes to keep a low profile.
Certainly. May I have your employer's account number and password, please?
Oh, of course. You realize, how should I say, there is a substantial amount of money in that account.
Replies.Didascalie: (looking at the account number, realizing who she is dealing with)

Replies.Reply: Of course. Would you feel more comfortable dealing with the bank president?
Right away. A glass of Cristal while you... Wait a moment...
There seems to have been a series of large withdrawals out of this account.
